title: Carol Twombly Typefaces
content: Does anyone know of certain Logos or movie posters that have been done in any typeface by [Carol Twombly](http://web.archive.org/web/20120428180605/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Carol%20Twombly)? and where I may find this information?
author: softbluecries1

comments.content: Statistics show that 28% of all [movie posters](http://web.archive.org/web/20120428180605/http:/www.flickr.com/groups/trajanfilmposter/) use [Trajan](http://web.archive.org/web/20120428180605/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=trajan) and 8% of all Mexican restaurants use [Lithos](http://web.archive.org/web/20120428180605/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=Lithos).

More [Trajan](http://web.archive.org/web/20120428180605/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Trajan) movie posters: [Requiem](http://web.archive.org/web/20120428180605/http:/www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=112), [The Illustionist](http://web.archive.org/web/20120428180605/http:/www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=133), and the titles for [Six Feet Under](http://web.archive.org/web/20120428180605/http:/www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=93).

What about 'Myriad' for the [iPod and other Apple stuff](http://web.archive.org/web/20120428180605/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple_typography#Myriad)? (Although that's technically a Twombly/Slimbach typeface.)

\>28% of all movie posters use Trajan

.28% of all movie posters use it appropriately... sometimes I wonder if the designers that make movie posters/dvd covers etc have Trajan set as their default font. Seems like it's save them time!
No, they get told: "Make it Oscar material". Read [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20120428180605/http:/typophile.com/node/29098) as well.

I find it a bit ironic that the two two faces she seems best known for (Trajan and Lithos) are adaptations of literally ancient designs, if I recall correctly. Even Goudy had a go at [Trajan](http://web.archive.org/web/20120428180605/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/goudy-trajan/) in 1930 (Revived by Jason Castle).

She won the Morisawa award for ['Mirarae'](http://web.archive.org/web/20120428180605/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/mirarae/), but you don't see that too often.

My personal favorite of hers, in a completely different vein is ['Nueva'](http://web.archive.org/web/20120428180605/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/nueva/), a lively, casual font that has a great range of color and utility, where you are not trying to weigh down the world with 'meaning' and importance.

- Mike Yanega

Yes Yves, but would you say it is Oscar material solely because of the strength of the typeface, or because at this point it is a precedent? When did it start spawning in the movie industry anyway?

\>Even Goudy had a go at Trajan in 1930

So did Tschichold, and so many others!
I convinced this is just a stupid case of there having been a precedent at some point. Hollywood execs aren't the most imaginative bunch -- just look at the movies they produce. :^P
